column4: For some reason, only OSS works on my system. What should I check to figure out why ALSA's not working.
more detail would be nice.

After installing the new flash 9, I noticed no sound. I heard that only alsa was supported, so I decided to double check my alsa was working by doing mplayer -ao alsa foo.mp3, which hangs. From this I'm concluding that alsa for some reason isn't working, and that I've been using OSS only for a while without noticing.
lsof /dev/dsp* /dev/snd/*

azrael@mobileDemon ~ $ lsof /dev/dsp* /dev/snd/*rnCOMMAND     PID   USER   FD   TYPE DEVICE SIZE NODE NAMErnfirefox-b 29829 azrael  mem    CHR 116,22      9444 /dev/snd/pcmC0D6prnfirefox-b 29829 azrael   48u   CHR 116,22      9444 /dev/snd/pcmC0D6p
ls /tmp/alsa*dmix*
azrael@mobileDemon ~ $ ls /tmp/alsa*dmix*rnls: /tmp/alsa*dmix*: No such file or directoryrnazrael@mobileDemon ~ $
are you watching/listening to a flash applet atm?
yes.
tail -2 /proc/asound/oss/sndstat
Crimsun: Mixers:rn0: SigmaTel STAC9200
(that's my modem it's identifying)
known issue with that mixer. I've already sent the appropriate patches to our kernel lead, and hopefully they'll be available in a new kernel soon.
in the meantime, pastebin ``amixer''
http://131.215.155.121/~azrael/amixerout
does increasing your 'PCM' level help?
Does not help.
This is not quiet sound, this is no sound. Additionally, mplayer in the past has been very valid at detecting whether sound systems are present and working.
(mplayer -ao alsa hung if you missed me saying that)
it's not a matter of it hanging. Like I said, I know about the issue. I've patched it. The fixes are ready but haven't been released in a Ubuntu kernel yet.
Is the patch available somewhere so I could apply it to kernel source and recompile myself?
depends if you want the easy way or the hard way. Do you use your own kernel?
At the moment, no. However, I migrated to ubuntu from gentoo, so I have a good deal of experience compiling kernels :P
then just grab alsa-kernel hg or jaroslav's git tree, and compile one.
